definition.name: NXapm_ranging
definition.doc:
Base class for the configuration and results of ranging definitions.
Ranging is a data post-processing step used in the research field of atom probe during which elemental, isotopic, and/or molecular identities are assigned to mass-to-charge-state-ratios within a certain interval. The documentation of these steps is based on ideas that have been described in the literature:
* `M. K. Miller <https://doi.org/10.1002/sia.1719>`_ * `D. Haley et al. <https://doi.org/10.1017/S1431927620024290>`_ * `M. Kühbach et al. <https://doi.org/10.1017/S1431927621012241>`_

field.name: number_of_ion_types
field.doc: How many ion types are distinguished. If no ranging was performed, each ion is of the special unknown type. The iontype ID of this unknown type is 0 representing a reserve value. Consequently, iontypes start counting from 1.

field.name: maximum_number_of_atoms_per_molecular_ion
field.doc: Assumed maximum value that suffices to store all relevant molecular ions, even the most complicated ones. Currently, a value of 32 is used (see M. Kühbach et al. <https://doi.org/10.1017/S1431927621012241>`_).

field.name: min_incr_max
field.doc: Smallest, increment, and largest mass-to-charge-state ratio value.

group.name: mass_spectrum
group.doc: A default histogram aka mass spectrum of the mass-to-charge-state ratio values.

group.name: background_quantification
group.doc: Details of the background model that was used to correct the total counts per bin into counts.

field.name: description
field.doc: To begin with we use a free-text field to learn how atom probers define a background model. Future versions of NXapm_ranging can then use this information to parameterize these models.

group.name: peak_search_and_deconvolution
group.doc: How where peaks in the background-corrected in the histogram of mass-to-charge-state ratio values identified?

group.name: peak_identification
group.doc: Details about how peaks, with taking into account error models, were interpreted as ion types or not.
